parsed.internal_thinking: After analyzing the board, Alice has taken a strong position at Node 42, securing high-yield Wheat (9, 9) and Ore (5). To compete, I need to focus on the other essential expansion resources: Wood and Brick. Node 20 is the highest yield available on the board with 12 total pips. It sits at the intersection of Hex 9 (Wood 11), Hex 5 (Brick 6), and Hex 4 (Sheep 8). The 6-Brick and 8-Sheep are particularly valuable as they are high-probability tiles. While Node 43 actually has a higher pip count (13), it is blocked by Alice's settlement at Node 42. Node 20 provides a balanced start for building roads and settlements, which will be crucial for securing a good second position with Wheat and Ore later in the setup phase. My strategy will be to use this strong resource base to expand quickly towards the ports or towards the Wheat/Ore clusters in the center-right of the board. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: Alice is heavily invested in Wheat and Ore. I've secured the best Brick/Sheep spot at Node 20. For my second settlement, I must prioritize Wheat and Ore (look at Node 25 or Node 14) to ensure I can upgrade to cities and buy development cards later. Watch Charlie's placements to see if he tries to cut off my path to the 3:1 port near Node 9.
parsed.say_outloud: Nice start, Alice! That's a lot of Wheat down there. I think I'll settle into this nice Brick and Sheep spot at Node 20 to keep the resource distribution interesting. Good luck, Charlie!
